PAL.NAME: Microsoft Exchange 2007 - HUB (TechNet)
PAL.DESCRIPTION: Includes counters and thresholds for the Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport server role based on the following product documentation: http://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb201704%28v=exchg.80%29

ANALYSIS.NAME: Hub Transport - LogicalDisk Avg. Disk sec/Read

THRESHOLD.NAME: Logical disk average disk read seconds average of 20ms or more, or spikes of 50ms or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Avg. Disk sec/Read is the average time, in seconds, of a read of data from the disk.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the average time, in seconds, of a read of data from the disk.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 20 milliseconds (ms) on average with spikes (maximum values) of less than 50 ms.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Hub Transport - LogicalDisk Avg. Disk sec/Write

THRESHOLD.NAME: Logical disk average disk write seconds average of 20ms or more, or spikes of 50ms or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Avg. Disk sec/Write is the average time, in seconds, of a write of data to the disk.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the average time, in seconds, of a write of data to the disk.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 20 ms on average with spikes (maximum values) of less than 50 ms.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Hub Transport - PhysicalDisk Avg. Disk sec/Read

THRESHOLD.NAME: Physical disk average disk read seconds average of 20ms or more, or spikes of 50ms or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Avg. Disk sec/Read is the average time, in seconds, of a read of data from the disk.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the average time, in seconds, of a read of data from the disk.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 20 milliseconds (ms) on average with spikes (maximum values) of less than 50 ms.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Hub Transport - PhysicalDisk Avg. Disk sec/Write

THRESHOLD.NAME: Physical disk average disk write seconds average of 20ms or more, or spikes of 50ms or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Avg. Disk sec/Write is the average time, in seconds, of a write of data to the disk.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the average time, in seconds, of a write of data to the disk.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 20 ms on average with spikes (maximum values) of less than 50 ms.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues)

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchangeTransport aggregate delivery queue length at 3000 or greater
MSExchangeTransport aggregate delivery queue length at 5000 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) is the number of messages queued for delivery in all queues.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages queued for delivery in all queues.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 3,000 and not more than 5,000.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. You can consider customizing both the aggregate and other limits to optimize performance for your environment.

For example, if the server normally processes 25 messages per second and you want the average message delay to be no more than 5 minutes before you are alerted, you would set the threshold to be 25 messages/second x 5 minutes x 60 seconds/minute = 7,500 messages. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Active Remote Delivery Queue Length

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchangeTransport active remote delivery queue length at 250 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Active Remote Delivery Queue Length is the number of messages in the active remote delivery queues.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages in the active remote delivery queues.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 250 at all times.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. You can consider customizing both the aggregate and other limits to optimize performance for your environment.

For example, if the server normally processes 25 messages per second and you want the average message delay to be no more than 5 minutes before you are alerted, you would set the threshold to be 25 messages/second x 5 minutes x 60 seconds/minute = 7,500 messages. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Active Mailbox Delivery Queue Length

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchangeTransport active mailbox delivery queue length at 250 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Active Mailbox Delivery Queue Length is the number of messages in the active mailbox queues.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages in the active mailbox queues.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 250 at all times.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. You can consider customizing both the aggregate and other limits to optimize performance for your environment.

For example, if the server normally processes 25 messages per second and you want the average message delay to be no more than 5 minutes before you are alerted, you would set the threshold to be 25 messages/second x 5 minutes x 60 seconds/minute = 7,500 messages. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Submission Queue Length

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchangeTransport submission queue length at 100 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Submission Queue Length is the number of messages in the Submission queue.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages in the submission queue.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should not exceed 100.

If sustained high values are occurring, investigate Active Directory and Mailbox servers for bottlenecks or performance-related issues.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. You can consider customizing both the aggregate and other limits to optimize performance for your environment.

For example, if the server normally processes 25 messages per second and you want the average message delay to be no more than 5 minutes before you are alerted, you would set the threshold to be 25 messages/second x 5 minutes x 60 seconds/minute = 7,500 messages. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Active Non-Smtp Delivery Queue Length

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchangeTransport active non-smtp delivery queue length at 250 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Active Non-SMTP Delivery Queue Length is the number of messages in the Drop directory that is used by a Foreign connector.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages in the Drop directory that is used by a Foreign connector.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 250 at all times.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. You can consider customizing both the aggregate and other limits to optimize performance for your environment.

For example, if the server normally processes 25 messages per second and you want the average message delay to be no more than 5 minutes before you are alerted, you would set the threshold to be 25 messages/second x 5 minutes x 60 seconds/minute = 7,500 messages. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Retry Mailbox Delivery Queue Length

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchangeTransport retry mailbox delivery queue length at 100 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Retry Mailbox Delivery Queue Length is the number of messages in retry.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages in a retry state attempting to deliver a message to a remote mailbox.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 100 at all times.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. You can consider customizing both the aggregate and other limits to optimize performance for your environment.

For example, if the server normally processes 25 messages per second and you want the average message delay to be no more than 5 minutes before you are alerted, you would set the threshold to be 25 messages/second x 5 minutes x 60 seconds/minute = 7,500 messages. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Retry Non-Smtp Delivery Queue Length

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchangeTransport retry non-smtp delivery queue length at 100 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Retry Non-SMTP Delivery Queue Length is the number of messages in retry in the non-SMTP gateway delivery queues.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages in a retry state in the non-Simple Mail Transfer Protocol (SMTP) gateway delivery queues.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should not exceed 100.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. You can consider customizing both the aggregate and other limits to optimize performance for your environment.

For example, if the server normally processes 25 messages per second and you want the average message delay to be no more than 5 minutes before you are alerted, you would set the threshold to be 25 messages/second x 5 minutes x 60 seconds/minute = 7,500 messages. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Retry Remote Delivery Queue Length

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchangeTransport retry remote delivery queue length at 100 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Retry Remote Delivery Queue Length is the number of messages in retry in the remote delivery queues.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages in a retry state in the remote delivery queues.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should not exceed 100.

We recommend that you check the next hop to determine the causes for queuing.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. You can consider customizing both the aggregate and other limits to optimize performance for your environment.

For example, if the server normally processes 25 messages per second and you want the average message delay to be no more than 5 minutes before you are alerted, you would set the threshold to be 25 messages/second x 5 minutes x 60 seconds/minute = 7,500 messages. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

NOTE:

Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Largest Delivery Queue Length

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchangeTransport largest delivery queue length at 200 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Largest Delivery Queue Length is the number of messages in the largest delivery queue.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages in the largest delivery queues.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Tthis value should be less than 200 for the Edge Transport and Hub Transport server roles.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Poison Queue Length
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Poison Message Queue Length is the number of messages in the poison message queue.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages in the poison message queue.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be 0 at all times.

NOTE:

When determining thresholds for queue lengths, you should consider server throughput as well as acceptable delivery delays before you need to be informed. The recommended maximum of 5,000 for the \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Aggregate Delivery Queue Length (All Queues) counter is for typical medium-size servers and typical maximum delays. You can consider customizing both the aggregate and other limits to optimize performance for your environment.

For example, if the server normally processes 25 messages per second and you want the average message delay to be no more than 5 minutes before you are alerted, you would set the threshold to be 25 messages/second x 5 minutes x 60 seconds/minute = 7,500 messages. However, if your server only processes an average of 5 messages/second, you would set the alert to be only 1,500 messages.

Keep in mind that this calculation does not mean that messages will always be delivered in under 5 minutes. Instead, the average delivery time for one particular server should be under 5 minutes. (Consider how many hops your messages may need to determine actual delivery time.) Also, consider the server hardware in your calculations because having large message queues can be a drain on server resources.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Messages Submitted Per Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Messages Submitted Per Second is the number of messages that have been queued in the Submission queue per second.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages that have been queued in the Submission queue per second.

Determines current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Messages Completed Delivery Per Second
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Messages Completed Delivery Per Second is the number of messages that are delivered per second.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages that are delivered per second.

Determines current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Driver Inbound: LocalDeliveryCallsPerSecond
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Inbound: Local Delivery Calls Per Second is the number of local delivery attempts per second.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of local delivery attempts per second.

Determines current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Driver Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Outbound: Submitted Mail Items Per Second is the number of mail items per second being submitted.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of mail items per second being submitted.

Determines current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport SmtpReceive Average bytes/message
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Average Bytes/Message is the average number of message bytes per inbound message received.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the average number of message bytes per inbound message received.

Determines sizes of messages being received for an SMTP receive connector.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport SmtpReceive Messages Received/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Messages Received/sec is the number of messages received by the SMTP server each second.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages received by the SMTP server each second.

Determines current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport SmtpSend Messages Sent/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Messages Sent/sec is the number of messages sent by the SMTP Send connector each second.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages sent by the SMTP send connector each second.

Determines current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Driver Inbound: MessageDeliveryAttemptsPerSecond
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Inbound: Message Delivery Attempts Per Second is the number of attempts for delivering transport mailitem per second.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of attempts for delivering transport mail items per second.

Determines current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Store Driver Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Store Driver(_total)\Inbound: Recipients Delivered Per Second

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Recipients delivered per second

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of inbound recipients delivered per second.

Determines current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Queues Messages Queued for Delivery Per Second
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Messages Queued for Delivery Per Second

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Messages Queued for Delivery Per Second
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Messages Queued for Delivery Per Second

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Messages Queued for Delivery Per Second
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchangeTransport Queues(_total)\Messages Queued for Delivery Per Second

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Messages Queued for Delivery Per Second is the number of messages that have been queued for delivery per second.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of messages that have been queued for delivery per second.

Determines current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Dumpster Dumpster Size
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Item Size is the total size (in bytes) of mail items that are currently in the Transport Dumpster on this server.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the total size (in bytes) of mail items that are currently in the transport dumpster on this server.

Shows overall size of the transport dumpster.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Dumpster Dumpster Inserts/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Insert Rate is the rate at which items are inserted into the Transport Dumpster on this server.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the rate at which items are inserted into the transport dumpster on this server.

Determines the current rate of transport dumpster inserts.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Dumpster Dumpster Item Count
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Item Count is the total number of mail items that are currently in the Transport Dumpster on this server.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the total number of mail items that are currently in the transport dumpster on this server.

Shows the current amount of items that are being held in the transport dumpster.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchangeTransport Dumpster Dumpster Deletes/sec
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Delete Rate is the rate at which items are deleted from the Transport Dumpster on this server.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the rate at which items are deleted from the transport dumpster on this server.

Determines the current rate of transport dumpster deletions.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Transport Database - MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Log Writes/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Writes/sec

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Writes/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Writes/sec

CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Writes/sec

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
I/O Log Writes/sec is the rate of logfile write operations completed.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the rate of log file write operations completed.

Determines the current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Transport Database - MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Log Reads/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Log Reads/sec

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
I/O Log Reads/sec is the rate of logfile read operations completed.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the rate of log file read operations completed.

Determines the current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Transport Database - MSExchange Database ==> Instances Log Generation Checkpoint Depth
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Generation Checkpoint Depth

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchange transport mail database log generation checkpoint depth at 1000 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Log Generation Checkpoint Depth represents the amount of work, in count of log files, that will need to be redone or undone to the database file(s) if the process crashes.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Represents the amount of work, in count of log files, that need to be redone or undone to the database files if the process fails.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 1,000 at all times.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Transport Database - MSExchange Database ==> Instances Version buckets allocated
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Version buckets allocated

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchange transport mail database version buckets allocated at 200 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Total number of version buckets allocated

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Total number of version buckets allocated

Shows the default backpressure values as listed in the edgetransport.exe.config file.

Exchange 2007 release to manufacturing (RTM) version - Medium=60, High=100

Exchange 2007 SP1 version â€“ Medium=120, High=200

For more database cache size guidance, see New maximum database cache size guidance for Exchange 2007 Hub Transport server role.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 200 at all times.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Transport Database - MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Database Reads/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Reads/sec

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
I/O Database Reads/sec is the rate of database read operations completed.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the rate of database read operations completed.

Determines the current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Transport Database - MSExchange Database ==> Instances I/O Database Writes/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\I/O Database Writes/sec

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
I/O Database Writes/sec is the rate of database write operations completed.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the rate of database write operations completed.

Determines the current load. Compare values to historical baselines.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Transport Database - MSExchange Database ==> Instances Log Record Stalls/sec
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Record Stalls/sec

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchange transport database log record stalls per second average of 10 or more, or spikes of 100 or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Log Record Stalls/sec is the number of log records that cannot be added to the log buffers per second because they are full. If this counter is non-zero most of the time, the log buffer size may be a bottleneck.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of log records that cannot be added to the log buffers per second because they are full. If this counter is non-zero most of the time, the log buffer size may be a bottleneck.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 10 per second on average with spikes (maximum values) of less than 100 per second.

ANALYSIS.NAME: Transport Database - MSExchange Database ==> Instances Log Threads Waiting
ANALYSIS.PRIMARYDATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting

DATASOURCE.NAME: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting
DATASOURCE.EXPRESSIONPATH: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting

CHART.CHARTTITLE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting
CHART.DATASOURCE: \MSExchange Database ==> Instances(edgetransport/Transport Mail Database)\Log Threads Waiting

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchange transport mail database log threads waiting average of 10 or more

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Log Threads Waiting is the number of threads waiting for their data to be written to the log in order to complete an update of the database. If this number is too high, the log may be a bottleneck.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the number of threads waiting for their data to be written to the log to complete an update of the database. If this number is too high, the log may be a bottleneck.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 10 threads waiting on average.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Extensibility Agents Average Agent Processing Time (sec)

THRESHOLD.NAME: MSExchange extensibility agents average agent processing time of 20 seconds or greater

ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Average agent processing time in seconds per event.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the average agent processing time in seconds per event.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

For Exchange Server 2007 Hub Transport servers, this value should be less than 20 at all times.

Sustained higher latencies may indicate a hung agent.

ANALYSIS.NAME: MSExchange Extensibility Agents Total Agent Invocations
ANALYSIS.DESCRIPTION:
Total number of agent invocations since the last restart.

TechNet Exchange Counter Description:

Shows the total number of invocations since the last restart.

Shows the current invocation rate.

TechNet Exchange Guidance:

Not Applicable.
